medical_history.chief_complaint: Right lower quadrant abdominal pain with nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient initially experienced lower abdominal pain radiating to the back, which she attributed to simple gas pain from a recent colonoscopy. The pain became more focal and localized to the right lower quadrant, accompanied by nonbilious emesis and diarrhea. She noted subjective fevers and chills earlier in the afternoon which resolved.
medical_history.family_history: Two maternal uncles with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
